Description: Sherd from neck and shoulder of East Greek pottery closed vase, probably amphora; handle zone painted black to left; left side of neck panel to right, two lines below maeander strip(?).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leiden University, Faculty of Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Prins de Jong 1925 / Scherben aus Naukratis: Aus der Sammlung des Universitäts-Professors Dr Fr W Freih von Bissing (p. 53, no. 5)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.068)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: III. 5 (cat. no. in Prins de Jong 1925)
